mendel.serialize

Class Serializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mendel.serialize.Serializer

  • public class Serializer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides convenience functions to make the Serialization and Deserialization process easier. In brief, the static methods in this class will initialize proper streams for reading or creating objects, do the work, and then close the streams.
    Author:
    malensek

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(ByteSerializable obj)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps a ByteSerializable object to a portable byte array.
        Parameters:
        obj - The ByteSerializable object to serialize.
        Returns:
        binary byte array representation of the object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deserialize

        public static <T extends ByteSerializable> T deserialize(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                         byte[] bytes)
                                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                                     SerializationException
        Loads a ByteSerializable object's binary form and then instantiates a new object using the SerializationInputStream constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create (deserialize). For example, Something.class.
        bytes - Binary form of the object being loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SerializationException

      • deserializeFromStream

        public static <T extends ByteSerializable> T deserializeFromStream(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                   SerializationInputStream in)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                                               SerializationException
        Deserializes and instantiates a ByteSerializable class from a stream. This method should only be used in cases where the type of the ByteSerializable class is not known at compile time.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create (deserialize). For example, Something.class.
        in - SerializationInputStream containing a serialized instance of the object being loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SerializationException

      • persist

        public static void persist(ByteSerializable obj,
           java.io.File file)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps a ByteSerializable object to a portable byte array and stores it on disk.
        Parameters:
        obj - The ByteSerializable object to serialize.
        file - File to write the ByteSerializable object to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • persist

        public static void persist(ByteSerializable obj,
           java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps a ByteSerializable object to a portable byte array and stores it on disk.
        Parameters:
        obj - The ByteSerializable object to serialize.
        fileName - path the object should be written to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • restore

        public static <T extends ByteSerializable> T restore(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                     java.io.File inFile)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 SerializationException
        Loads a ByteSerializable object's binary form from disk and then instantiates a new object using the SerializationInputStream constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create (deserialize). For example, Something.class.
        inFile - File containing a serialized instance of the object being loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SerializationException

      • restore

        public static <T extends ByteSerializable> T restore(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                     java.lang.String fileName)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 SerializationException
        Loads a ByteSerializable object's binary form from disk and then instantiates a new object using the SerializationInputStream constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create (deserialize). For example, Something.class.
        fileName - path the object should be read from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SerializationException
